definition:
A fibre map is a map of topological spaces $f: E \rightarrow B$, for
which there exists a space $F$, such that any point of $B$ is contained
in some neighbourhood $U$ satisfying the following: on $f^{-1}U$, $f$
restricts to the natural projection $F \times U \rightarrow U$, via some
homeomorphic identification of $f^{-1}U$ with $F \times U$.

One class of examples are covering maps. Another example is the map
$SO_3 \rightarrow S^2$ sending a rotation to the point it sends the
“North Pole” to.
